benchmark_details.name: CMMU (Chinese Multi-modal Multi-type Question Understanding)
benchmark_details.overview: CMMU is a novel benchmark for multi-modal and multi-type question understanding and reasoning in Chinese. It consists of 3,603 questions in 7 subjects, covering knowledge from primary to high school, featuring multiple-choice, multiple-response, and fill-in-the-blank questions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the multi-modal and multi-type question understanding and reasoning abilities of multi-modal large language models (MLLMs) in Chinese.

data.source: The questions were collected from diverse exams and educational materials, comprising both text and images.
data.annotation: Questions were manually reviewed and corrected, including transformation of formulas into LaTeX format.

methodology.calculation: Positional Error Variance measures the extent of position bias in multiple-choice questions through cyclically changing the positions of the answer options.
methodology.interpretation: A model is considered proficient if it can answer questions correctly across diverse formats without showing significant positional bias.
methodology.baseline_results: CMMU was evaluated against several MLLMs, with performance varied across different question types and subjects.
methodology.validation: The validation set consists of 1,800 questions, while the test set has 1,803 questions.
